This forum won't let me post more than 5 times in a 24 hour period which is terrible when I need someone to talk to and am not allowed to communicate with anyone. Anyhow, guess what was in my mailbox today?? A "form letter" from the doctors office saying that my lump is "benign".Â My doctor is on vacation, so does this mean he isn't even going to talk to me??? IÂ still don't know how they can guarantee me that it isn't cancerous unless they do aÂ biopsy. Am I beingÂ completely ignorant about all of this? Should I justÂ trust them?? Even without testing??? I just don't want to hearÂ them say to me next year "oops, we should have done something last year before it was too late"!!! And, this lump hurts. Do I have to put up with this every day of my life?? You guys all have great advice and I appreciate EVERYTHING you guys are telling me. I've learned a lot, butÂ I don't know whether to get a second opinion or demand that it be removed. The technician told me that itÂ could go away and I may get more. Isn't that a heck of a thing to tell someone?? I'll always be worrying about it now....UGH!!!!!! Â Â Â Â

The doctor I went to is actually my gynocologist. My whole ordeal is starting to sound exactly like yours. I'm not afraid of surgery at all, I just want to be 100% sure it isn't cancer and I want it out of me because it hurts. The technician actually told me it might go away and that I may get more!!!! Â I've known too many women that were told they have fibrocysticÂ breasts and then find out too late that cancer was there the whole time.
